text:
There are a bunch of benefits to using react — but those are related to just the general benefits of react.
• Code splitting
• Server components
• Easier to componentize builds
• Auto escaping content for XSS attacks
• etc
But at the end of the day — Both will get the job done and will be good to use!
OK -- fair enough. But I also put a div around the section completely outside of the section and that's not showing up either.
But I may be able to make it as a saved section and try that
It would have to be entirely out of the `dnd_area`
Are saved sections editable ?
:expressionless: oh my, HubSpot is a bit special sometimes
I just want to add a custom class to a section, I don't understand why they won't let me do it. So maybe I just need to make a completely separate DND area then?

`saved sections` will get you there. Those can be included in your current dnd_area. Or dragged in via the editor.

> It would have to be entirely out of the `dnd_area`
Was a reference the wrapper not showing up. As I mentioned above, only DND / hubl syntax is valid inside of a DND area. All other raw html markup is stripped out.
gotcha. If I have a saved section in there, when I open the tempalte in the editor, can the text be modified and such ?

> gotcha. If I have a saved section in there, when I open the tempalte in the editor, can the text be modified and such ?
Yes
Thank you for your help! hopefully this will help me get this project finished.
I think cms react is still in beta

One more question, once I do make an update to the page blog list template, should I just refresh the preview and it should show those changes? And if it's not showing them and it should, then what? Do I have to change the template to a different one and then back? do I need to delete the whole blog and make it again? I'm just very confused. So I added some text outside of the DND area and that's not showing up either.
If youre in DM any updates to the template should be showing up in the Design manager, template preview.
It doesn't seem to be doing that. If I delete all of the modules in the actual editor and refresh, it doesn't seem to be loading the ones from the tempalte
It's like the editor is overriding the template ?
Maybe I just need to give up and just build it in the editor and not in the DM

Yes — the editor is overriding the template. <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CMXUWUY5D/p1738696141769059?thread_ts=1738686352.772529&cid=CMXUWUY5D|I mentioned that up here>. However if preview the template in DM you should see those updates reflected.
the preview just matches the editor
Are you in Page editor > preview or Design manger > template > preview
I am in both
I am trying to edit it in the Design manager but when I actually preview the page it's not showing the changes I made in Design Manager
I used the page editor to customize a module, then used developer tools to copy the hubl into the template
If you click on this preview do you see the edits?

How can I reset the page to use the template and not the editor or is that not possible? Do I just need to delete the whole blog and create it again? I didn't realize doing that would break everything.
I just added text outside of DND area that says "Test" and no, it's not showing it on that preview either.
OK, I feel like a dummy, I had it outside of {% block body %}, when I put it inside that then it's showing up. but it's not showing up when I preview the page from the editor.

Yea im not sure if there is a way to totally hook it back up so that the dnd_area page-level overrides are reset. I think that the page editor was intentionally set up this way so that template’s could be modified without affecting existing content.
OK, sounds like I may just use the editor instead of messing with this template.
Thanks for your help.
You _*Might*_ be able to achieve it via page history. Resetting all the way back to the first version of the page pre edits
I already tried that, didn't work :stuck_out_tongue:
Adding `?developermode=true` to the editor slug will give you the option to reset back to template default. Note that it will blast away all of your content / settings that was added via page editor
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/guides/cms/debugging/troubleshooting#developer-mode-in-the-page-editor>
okay got it. Thanks <@UQWGKUEN7>
